Adult/immature.description: Shrikes have the same overall pattern as mockingbirds but have blacker wings, a bigger head, a black mask, and a heavy, hooked bill unlike Northern Mockingbirds which have grayer wings and face and a thin bill.

Shrikes have the same overall pattern as mockingbirds but have blacker wings, a bigger head, a black mask, and a heavy, hooked bill unlike Northern Mockingbirds which have grayer wings and face and a thin bill.
Gray Catbirds are darker gray, with no white in the wings or tail like Northern Mockingbirds.

Adult.description: Townsend's Solitaires are birds of the mountains; they have a white eyering and a small, buffy mark in the wing rather than bold white wingbars seen on Northern Mockingbirds in flight.

Breeding male.description: Blue-gray Gnatcatchers are less than half the size of a Northern Mockingbird, with a white eyering and a tendency to flit quietly through high branches unlike mockingbirds which are loud and conspicuous.

Adult.description: Sage Thrashers have streaked underparts whereas Northern Mockingbirds have clean whitish underparts. Sage Thrashers do not flash white in wings or tail like mockingbirds.
